required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Open-label Extension (OLE) Study of Plecanatide for Chronic Idiopathic Constipation (CIC)
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label Extension (OLE), Long-term Safety and Tolerability Study of Plecanatide in Patients With Chronic Idiopathic Constipation (CIC)

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multi-center, open-label, 52-week safety and tolerability study of plecanatide in patients with Chronic Idiopathic Constipation (CIC).

detailed_description.textblock:
This is an open-label extension study of plecanatide in the treatment of patients with CIC who previously completed Synergy Protocols SP304-20210 and SP304203-00 (The CIC3 Study).
The planned duration of each patient's study participation is up to 411 days, including up to 33 days of screening, 8 study visits over 52 weeks of treatment and a follow-up visit 2 weeks after the last dose of study drug.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With at Least One Treatment-Emergent Adverse Event (TEAE)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose up to 72 weeks
primary_outcome.description: All clinically significant findings upon Physical Examinations of the Safety Population during the treatment period were reported as TEAEs. Safety was evaluated based on number of patients who experienced at least one TEAE.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With at Least One Treatment-Emergent Adverse Event (TEAE) Leading to Discontinuation of Plecanatide
primary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose up to 72 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Tolerability was evaluated based on number of patients who experienced at least one TEAE leading to discontinuation of the study drug

primary_outcome.measure: Summary of Vital Signs at >Day 364 - Blood Pressure (Systolic and Diastolic; mmHg)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose up to 72 weeks
primary_outcome.description: The vital signs included in the assessments were blood pressure (systolic and diastolic; mmHg), heart rate (beats per minute), body temperature (°C) and respiration rate (breaths per minute).

primary_outcome.measure: Summary of Vital Signs at >Day 364 - Heart Rate (Beats Per Minute)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose up to 72 weeks
primary_outcome.description: The vital signs included in the assessments were blood pressure (systolic and diastolic; mmHg), heart rate (beats per minute), body temperature (°C) and respiration rate (breaths per minute).

primary_outcome.measure: Summary of Vital Signs at >Day 364 - Body Temperature (°C)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose up to 72 weeks
primary_outcome.description: The vital signs included in the assessments were blood pressure (systolic and diastolic; mmHg), heart rate (beats per minute), body temperature (°C) and respiration rate (breaths per minute).

primary_outcome.measure: Summary of Vital Signs at >Day 364 - Respiration Rate (Breaths Per Minute)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose up to 72 weeks
primary_outcome.description: The vital signs included in the assessments were blood pressure (systolic and diastolic; mmHg), heart rate (beats per minute), body temperature (°C) and respiration rate (breaths per minute).

primary_outcome.measure: Summary of ECG Results Shift From Baseline at > Day 364
primary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose up to 72 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Baseline was defined as the last non-missing value collected prior to first dose of study drug)

primary_outcome.measure: Summary of Treatment-Emergent Laboratory Abnormalities With At Least a 1-grade Shift From Baseline
primary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose up to 72 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Baseline was defined as the last non-missing value collected prior to first dose of study drug within a given entry into the study. The Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE), Grades 1 through 5 were used for descriptions of severity for each Adverse Event (AE): Grade 1 - Mild; asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated; Grade 2 - Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age appropriate instrumental Activities of Daily Living (ADL); Grade 3 - Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization indicated; disabling; limiting self care ADL; Grade 4 - Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated; Grade 5 - Death related to AE.

secondary_outcome.measure: Summary of Patient Patient Global Assessment (PGA) for Constipation Severity at > Day 364
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Form first dose up to 72 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Constipation severity was measured using a 5-point score: 1=None, 2=Mild, 3=Moderate, 4=Severe, 5=Very severe Baseline was defined as the last non-missing value collected prior to first dose of study drug within a given entry into the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Summary of Patient Global Assessment (PGA) for Constipation - Change From Baseline to > Day 364
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose up to 72 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Change of Constipation measured using a 7-point score: 1=Very Much Improved, 2=Much Improved, 3=Minimally Improved, 4=No change, 5=Minimally Worse, 6=Much Worse, 7=Very Much Worse Baseline is defined as the last non-missing value collected prior to first dose of study drug within a given entry into the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Summary of Patient Global Assessment (PGA) for Treatment Satisfaction at > Day 364
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose up to 72 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline was defined as the last non-missing value collected prior to first dose of study drug within a given entry into the study. Treatment Satisfaction was measured using a 5-point score: 1=Not At All Satisfied, 2=A Little Satisfied, 3=Moderately Satisfied, 4=Quite Satisfied, 5=Very Satisfied.

secondary_outcome.measure: Summary of Patient Global Assessment (PGA) for Treatment Continuation at End of Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose up to 72 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment continuation was measured using 5-point score: 1=Not At All Likely, 2=A Little Likely, 3=Moderately Likely, 4=Quite Likely, 5=Very Likely

arm_group.description: Plecanatide 3.0 mg, one tablet by mouth daily for 52 weeks
Plecanatide 6.0 mg, one tablet by mouth daily for 52 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient completed a previous double-blind plecanatide study and was compliant with the study requirements.
- Patient is in good health without unstable acute illness or exacerbation of an unstable chronic illness or chronic disease that may affect study assessments, particularly if there has been a significant change to health status since the previous plecanatide study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient has had major surgery including laparoscopic procedures requiring general anesthesia within 60 days of Day 1.
- Patient has a medical history of hepatitis B, hepatitis C or human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection.
- Patient has taken a protocol-prohibited drug without the appropriate washout period.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Patients with CIC who completed the double-blind phase 2b (NCT01429987) study, or phase 3 (NCT01982240 or NCT0222471) studies or who screen-failed for the phase 3 studies due solely to pre-treatment diary compliance and met all of the inclusion criteria and none of the exclusion criteria enrolled into this open-label study.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 2370 enrolled patients who had received at least one dose of the study drug constituted the Safety Population.

group.description: Plecanatide 3 mg, one tablet by mouth daily for up to 72 weeks

group.description: Plecanatide 6 mg, one tablet by mouth daily for up to 72 weeks

baseline.population: A total of 2321 patients were based on the Safety Population (2370) excluding all duplicate patients except identified as "Index" patients. "Index" was duplicate patients appeared the first time in the enrollment.

A total of 2378 patients including the re-enrolled patients who previously participated and completed this open-label study was used for assessments.

reported_events.desc: All enrolled patients (2370) who received at least one dose of study drug was included in the risk analysis. There was one death, unrelated to study drug, reported in this study; the patient died from a myocardial infarction (MI) that was related to a cocaine-induced coronary vasopasm.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There IS an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
